text:
Hi Community,

Does anyone have a guide on how the added GCLID to HubSpot? Been following this article here but not luck:<https://zackphilipps.com/store-gclid-cookie-send-to-HubSpot/>

Hello!
Does anyone have experience developing an ecommerce of a product in HubSpot CMS? It has to be a development from scratch, without using shopify, magento and other platforms.
Why would you build this from scratch?
<@U7JMJHGUF> I echo <@UD53A9UUR> question… Is this a client request?
and if it is, let them know that this is going to be expensive and take a long time

You can always use <https://www.ecwid.com/> which is a pure client side (Javascript) implementation of an e-commerce store.  I was forced to do this for a client’s WP site and, honestly, it wasn’t terrible.
It should. You can verify by looking at the source of the page and seeing if your pages have srcset attributes on them.
Oh, I just reread your message as to not relying on 3rd party vendors. Sorry.  Then I echo the others - WHY!?
Is anyone else having problems adding a new brand or subdomain microsite on Enterprise accounts?  That functionality seems to be gone.
Actually it says I have to upgrade. But these are Enterprise accounts. And on one of them we already have like 10 brands and 2 subdomains.
Following as I too would like to know more about this project.

<@UD53A9UUR> <@UA5DFM7CK>
It is a proposal of my agency, since we want to use the customization and interaction resources of HubSpot CMS.
Can you please elaborate?

<@U7TAZ6V2Q>
The payment gateway to use would be <https://www.culqi.com/>

<@U2H3TT8F2> <@UD53A9UUR> <@UA5DFM7CK> <@UBYC97LGJ> <@U7TAZ6V2Q> The requirement is: The complete website will be implemented in HubSpot CMS, its recommendation was to implement its electronic commerce (multi-product) on the same platform. On the other hand, the payment platform is <http://culqi.com|culqi.com>, it does not have a native integration with HubSpot.
let us know how this goes for you. i admit that i am curious :slightly_smiling_face:

I looked over Culqi (thx GTranslate). It’s a payment solution similar to Stripe.  While it is possible to build your “store” frontend entirely on HubSpot, and maybe create a Javascript cart to store user selections, you will still need server side coding/program  (outside of HubSpot) to facilitate the purchase process. It’s simple enough to create something like that to accept and process the payment. However, if you need other “ecommerce” type features that a full solution like Shopify affords,  then you’ll still have to code all those other features, like logging the sale to a database, shipping and tax rate calculations, fulfillment management, sales reporting.  You simply cannot build all that on HubSpot alone.
god help you if it is a physical good
With your experience, what would be the best option to develop electronic commerce? The prices are fixed of the product, they do not have shipping costs.
How many products? Are they simple products (no variants or options)?
licenses? subscriptions?
<@U7TAZ6V2Q> It is for health insurance sales, they have no variants. There will be a validation of the identity document for registration
Just a quick question, when you mention health insurance sales, I am assuming HIPAA will be playing a role in this (or something similar to HIPAA)?

<@U2H3TT8F2> brings up a good point. Compliance and security would be a separate but important issue. For e-commerce it sounds like maybe you just need a payment form to purchase insurance. Could be doable but would require some custom coding to handle the payment.  Also, HubSpot is releasing a payment feature as well - it was announced at Inbound but there’s not much info publicly yet. Maybe AJ can shed some light?
